title: Dortmund edge 1-0 win against table-topping Monchengladbach without suspended Jaden Sancho
text:
Table-toppers Borussia Monchengladbach were beaten by a solitary goal at Signal Iduna Park as Dortmund closed the gap on the leading pack.

Dortmund were without English winger Jaden Sancho after dropping him because he reportedly arrived back at HQ from international duty late.

In his absence, captain Marco Rues stepped up, striking on the hour mark after a precise through ball from another Gladbach alumni, Thorgan Hazard.

Marco Reus celebrates the winning goal in Dortmund's game against Monchengladbach

The strike was the German's fifth goal in the Bundesliga so far this season, in eight games

He slipped the ball through the legs of keeper Yann Sommer for the goal that gave Dortmund their first win in four league games.

It was the German's fifth goal in the Bundesliga so far this season and his ninth goal in the twelve games against Monchengladbach since he left them in 2012.

He got in the way when Julian Brandt looked to have made it 2-0 with just six minutes to go. But Rues' offside position in Yann Sommer's eye line meant he was offside and the goal was chalked off - as was a first half strike from Thorgan Hazard.

Lucien Favre gestures while taking to Thorgan Hazard, who provided the assist for Reus' goal

Moenchengladbach's Breel Embolo and Dortmund's Swiss goalkeeper Roman Burki

The Ruhr valley club move up to fourth on 15 points, level with third-placed Bayern Munich, who drew 2-2 at Augsburg, and RB Leipzig.

Gladbach, on 16 points, lead the standings ahead of unbeaten VfL Wolfsburg, who drew 1-1 with Leipzig, on goal difference.
description: Dortmund were without English winger Jaden Sancho after dropping him because he reportedly arrived back at HQ from international duty late but still managed to beat the table-toppers.
